Posts.Content: picardlx wrote: My sister is 22yrs old and I have heard from some people that a woman should become proactive in breast cancer exams/screenings approximately 10 years prior to her mother's diagnosis. My mother died of breast cancer at the age of 32. My sister has repeatedly asked to get a mammogram, but her family physician does not believe an exam is necessary at this point. Both my sister and I are worried that our concerns are not being taken seriously. Are we overreacting? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Fear that Dr. may not be taking us seriously. picardlx HeatherF

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2009 12:51AM picardlx wrote: Thank you all for your comments and suggestions. We will pursue second opinions and also look into the university cancer centers in Chicago since she lives there. I'm also going to check the Blue Cross/Blue Shield Coverage contract to see if there are any age restrictions, but if I have to I'll pay cash. This may be an dumb question and excuse me if it is: Am I (as a male) at any increased risk of cancer given my mother's early and aggressive form of breast cancer?
Posts.Title: Fear that Dr. may not be taking us seriously. picardlx HeatherF
